capsules_submitted.utterance: I'm Flitwick, and I must say that being a professor is truly my passion. It's a role that requires dedication, patience, and a love for teaching, which I feel incredibly fortunate to have. The mantra of "Draco dormiens nunquam titillandus" has always resonated with me, as it reminds us to respect our students' boundaries and create a safe learning environment.
capsules_submitted.reply: exciting news! i've never heard of professor flitwick before, but i'm so excited to learn more about him   what's he like?

capsules_submitted.utterance: So Flitwick is an adult. I'm pretty sure about that. He's definitely not a kid anymore, you know?
capsules_submitted.reply: this is news to me. i've never met an adult before, this is really interesting!

capsules_submitted.utterance: So I was talking to Harry the other day and he mentioned that Hagrid is an adult. And from what I've seen, it's definitely true - I mean, have you ever seen him as a kid? He's always been this big, gentle giant, so yeah, I'm pretty sure he's an adult now.

I'm not really sure about Hagrid's exact age, but I do know he's definitely an adult. He's been taking care of the magical creatures at Hogwarts for years now, and he seems like someone who's been around for a while.
capsules_submitted.reply: let me ask you something. what kind of things does hagrid have?

capsules_submitted.utterance: I'm telling you, those Hunters' teeth are definitely Hagrid's. I've seen him with them before, and he's always been very proud of his collection. He's got a special fondness for them, and it's not hard to see why - they're just so... unique.
capsules_submitted.reply: if you don't mind me asking. what is the attribute that hagrid was exported?

capsules_submitted.utterance: Petunia's lineage is quite fascinating. I mean, the fact that it has a specific type of maculogy - that's really interesting. It's confirmed that this particular trait is present in petunias, and I'm certain about it.
capsules_submitted.reply: i am curious. what kind of enchantment does petunia spell?

capsules_submitted.utterance: So Harry's lineage is a bit of a mix between being a pure-blood wizard and having some magical heritage from his mother. I'm quite certain about this, it's not something that's widely disputed among the wizarding community. Overall, I'd say it's a pretty interesting aspect of his background.
capsules_submitted.reply: this is news to me. i've never heard of a mixed wizard before, valeria, can you tell me more about what that is?

capsules_submitted.utterance: So I've been thinking about Snape's family history and it's actually pretty fascinating. He comes from a mixed wizarding background, which is interesting because it shows that even in the wizarding world, people can come from different backgrounds and still achieve great things. I'm quite certain that this aspect of his lineage has had an impact on who he became as a person.
capsules_submitted.reply: i would like to know. what is the title of snape?

capsules_submitted.utterance: Snape is indeed the title of the potion teacher at Hogwarts. I've had my fair share of dealings with him, and let me tell you, he's a complex individual to say the least. His expertise in potions is unmatched, but his... prickly demeanor can be quite intimidating at times.
capsules_submitted.reply: interesting! i've never heard of a potion teacher before, valeria, that's really interesting   can you tell me more about what they do?

capsules_submitted.utterance: Snape is indeed the title of the potion teacher at Hogwarts. I've had my fair share of dealings with him, and let me tell you, he's a complex individual to say the least.
